me.lihq.game.screen.elements

Class UIHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.lihq.game.screen.elements.UIHelpers

  • public class UIHelpers
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides various factory methods for use in creating a UI.

      • createBackgroundTexture

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture createBackgroundTexture(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color colour,
                                                                        int width,
                                                                        int height)
        Creates a new block texture, for use as the background of UI controls.
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour of the texture
        width - The width of the texture
        height - The height of the texture
        Returns:
        A new texture with the specified parameters

                                                                                      int width,
                                                                                      int height)
        Creates a new block texture, and returns it as a Drawable object.

        width - The width of the texture

      • createLabel

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label createLabel(java.lang.String text,
                                                                   boolean title)
        Creates a new label, using the style defined in UI_SKIN. If the label is a title, its default position is set to the middle of the top of the screen.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display in the label
        title - Use the title font
        Returns:
        A new label with the standard style and specified text

      • createLabel

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label createLabel(java.lang.String text,
                                                                   com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font)
        Creates a new label with the specified text and font, and the standard text colour. This generates a new LabelStyle on the fly, which is less efficient than using one of the pre-existing ones defined in UI_SKIN. If the font is arial of size 20 or 30, therefore, use createLabel(String, boolean) instead.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display in the label
        font - The font to use
        Returns:
        A new label with the specified text and font

      • createLabel

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label createLabel(java.lang.String text,
                                                                   com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font,
                                                                   com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color colour)
        Creates a new label with the specified text, font and colour. Identical to a call to createLabel(String, BitmapFont), except it allows you to set the text colour as well.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display in the label
        font - The font to use
        colour - The colour of the text
        Returns:
        A new label with the specified text, font and colour

      • createTextButton

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.TextButton createTextButton(java.lang.String text)
        Creates a new text button, using the style defined in UI_SKIN.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display in the button
        Returns:
        A new text button with the standard style and specified text

      • createButton

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Button createButton()
        Creates a new button, using the style defined in UI_SKIN.
        Returns:
        A new text button with the standard style and specified text

      • createCheckBox

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.CheckBox createCheckBox(java.lang.String text)
        Creates a new checkbox, using the style defined in UI_SKIN. Prepends the text with 2 spaces, to add a gap between it and the checkbox texture.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display next to the checkbox
        Returns:
        A new checkbox with the standard style and specified text

      • createSlider

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Slider createSlider(float min,
                                                                     float max,
                                                                     float stepSize,
                                                                     boolean vertical)
        Creates a new slider control, using the style define in UI_SKIN.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value of the slider
        max - The maximum value of the slider
        stepSize - The size of the increments
        vertical - Whether the slider should be vertical or horizontal
        Returns:
        A new slider with the standard style and specified attributes
